chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gage J Grotjahn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:35 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Gage J Grotjahn in court with Attorney Stephen Michael Govin. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS Count #1 to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to 947.01(1)

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1 & #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Counts #1 & #2, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--No acts/threats of violence 
--AODA Assessment (within 60 days of disposition) & Follow Through, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To maintain employment and/or education program
--To pay costs of $486 ($243 each count)
--To pay $400 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or non-prescribed controlled substances
--Maintain absolute sobriety

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Court does not make finding of expungement
Recess: 11:52 am
With JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 1:22 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Gage J Grotjahn in court with Attorney Stephen Michael Govin. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Govin: Requests matter be set for a plea hearing in 45 days; discussions revolved around misdemeanor convictions
ADA Shock: No objection
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Govin indicates that this will likely be a stipulated recommendation
Court reminds Mr. Grotjahn that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 1:25 pm

NEXT:  Schedule Plea/Sentencing Hearing 9/18/15 at 11:30 am - Send notices **Please Note - PRELIMINARY HRG. HAS NOT YET BEEN CONDUCTED/WAIVED**

Case called at 3:01pm [mo]
Defendant Gage J Grotjahn in court.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
 
Mr. Grotjahn verifies date of birth and address on Criminal Complaint
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Mr. Grotjahn requests an attorney

The Court requires a $1500   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
recess : 3:07pm

NEXT:   Adjourned Initial Appearance--June 23, 2015 at 2:00pm
